intro: Potamophila parviflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved waterplantain, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Alismataceae family and typically grows in shallow water or moist soils. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in marshes, stream margins, and other aquatic habitats. Due to its preference for wet conditions, it plays an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting aquatic ecosystems.
